body_html:
@jramapuram You were able to install it on Manjaro?

My system says I have CUDA 9.0

nvcc --version

nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver
Copyright (c) 2005-2017 NVIDIA Corporation
Built on Fri_Sep__1_21:08:03_CDT_2017
Cuda compilation tools, release 9.0, V9.0.176

However, explicitly telling it to install the version compiled for 9.0, it ignores it and wants to install the version for cuda91

sudo conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch

    pytorch:     0.3.1-py36_cuda9.1.85_cudnn7.0.5_2 pytorch [cuda91]
    torchvision: 0.2.0-py36h17b6947_1               pytorch

I downgraded Cuda from 9.1 to 9.0 according to https://forum.manjaro.org/t/cuda-9-1-not-compatible-with-nvidia-384/37461/18, but it did not seem to help

I guess this is more a Manjaro error than Pytorch.

body:
@jramapuram You were able  to install it on Manjaro?

My system says I have CUDA 9.0

```
nvcc --version

nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver
Copyright (c) 2005-2017 NVIDIA Corporation
Built on Fri_Sep__1_21:08:03_CDT_2017
Cuda compilation tools, release 9.0, V9.0.176

```

However, explicitly telling it to install the version compiled for 9.0, it ignores it and wants to install the version for cuda91 

```
sudo conda install pytorch torchvision cuda90 -c pytorch

    pytorch:     0.3.1-py36_cuda9.1.85_cudnn7.0.5_2 pytorch [cuda91]
    torchvision: 0.2.0-py36h17b6947_1               pytorch

```
I downgraded Cuda from 9.1 to 9.0 according to https://forum.manjaro.org/t/cuda-9-1-not-compatible-with-nvidia-384/37461/18, but it did not seem to help

I guess this is more a Manjaro error than Pytorch.
